sections.heading: Unlawful uses of computer system
Definition of terms.
Penalties for unlawful use of computer systems.
Civil rights not affected.
sections.text:
43-43B-7. Civil rights not affected.

The provisions of this chapter shall neither enlarge nor diminish the rights of parties in civil litigation.

Source:SL 1982, ch 300, §8.

sections.heading: Venue for violations.
sections.text:
43-43B-8. Venue for violations.

For the purpose of venue under the provisions of this chapter, any violation of this chapter shall be considered to have been committed: in any county in which any act was performed in furtherance of any transaction violating this chapter; in any county in which any violator had control or possession of any proceeds of said violation or of any books, records, documents, property, financial instrument, computer software, computer program, or other material, objects or items which were used in any county from which, to which, or through which any access to a computer, computer system, or computer network was made whether by wires, electromagnetic waves, microwaves, or any other means of communication.

Source:SL 1984, ch 282, §5.
